page.title: 13LINCOLNSHIRE AVIATION MUSEUM
page.content: {The museum started in 1970. It was {started by volunteers of the Lincs. {Aviation Trust. }It has from ten to twelve aircraft.The oldest is the Pou-de-Ceil which was built in 1935 they call it the French Sky Louse or the Flying Flea.{The museum is a great {success and covers one acre. Fifty {people run it. They will soon be {moving to another site at Hemswell {near Gainsborough. The people at the {museum do not get paid.When the museum {started the building was a station. The heaviest aircraft in the museum is the twin engine aircraft.The first aircraft they got was the Proctor which was found in a garden in 1943. {They have 5000 visitors a year In the museum you can see aircraft engines,cockpit sections,models,relics vehicles and the Lincolnshire V.C.gallery.
